Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Beads
Description: A few irregular ring-shaped beads of decreasing sizes.  This type of adornment was greatly appreciated by Nubian populations -Kerma and C-Group- between 2400 and 2000 B.C.  All gabbro beads unearthed at Sai were discovered in Old Kerma burials.
